required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing OsseoSpeed™ Implants of Two Different Lengths in the Upper and Lower Posterior Jaw
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Prospective, Randomized, Multi-center Study Comparing OsseoSpeed™ Implant 6 mm With OsseoSpeed™ Implant 11 mm in the Posterior Maxilla and Mandible. A 5-year Follow-up Study.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if OsseoSpeed™ implant 6 mm long is effective for rehabilitation of edentulism and if so, how it compares with OsseoSpeed™ implant 11 mm long. The primary hypothesis is that the alteration in bone level is equal in patients randomized to 6 mm as to patients randomized to 11 mm implants.

primary_outcome.measure: Radiological Assessments of Marginal Bone Level Alteration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated from implant installation to 5 years follow-up after implant placement
primary_outcome.description: Marginal Bone Level determined from radiographs and expressed as the difference from a reference point on the implant to the most coronal bone-to-implant contact on the mesial and distal aspect of the implant. Marginal Bone Level expressed in millimeters at the 5 year follow-up visit compared to values obtained at delivery of temporary restoration i.e. loading (baseline). Positive value = bone gain, Negative value = bone loss.

secondary_outcome.description: Overall implant survival, measured on implant level

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment BoP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at the 5-year follow-up visit after loading
secondary_outcome.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of Bleeding on Probing (BoP). Presented as s count of implants that show presence of BoP.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment of Change in PPD
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at implant loading and at the 5-year follow-up visit.
secondary_outcome.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of change in probing pocket depth (PPD). Change in pocket depth expressed in millimeters at the 5-year follow-up visit, compared to values obtained at delivery of permanent restoration, i.e. loading (baseline). Negative value = increased pocket depth.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at the 5-year follow-up visit after loading.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of plaque was evaluated at four surfaces around each study position (mesial, facial, distal and lingual). Plaque was recorded as presence or absence of plaque by visual inspection. A study position was considered as bleeding "yes" if at least one of the four surfaces around the implant showed presence of bleeding on probing.

arm_group.description: Subjects treated with OsseoSpeed™ implant, length: 6 mm
Subjects treated with OsseoSpeed™ implant, length: 11 mm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of informed consent
- Aged 20-70 years at enrolment
- History of edentulism in the study area of at least four months
- Neighboring tooth/teeth to the planned bridge must have natural root(s)
- Presence of natural teeth, partial prosthesis and/or implants in the opposite jaw in contact with the planned bridge.
- Deemed by the investigator to have a bone height of at least 11 mm and a bone width of minimum 6 mm
- Deemed by the investigator as likely to present an initially stable implant situation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unlikely to be able to comply with study procedures, as judged by the investigator
- Earlier graft procedures in the study area
- Uncontrolled pathologic processes in the oral cavity
- Known or suspected current malignancy
- History of radiation therapy in the head and neck region
- History of chemotherapy within 5 years prior to surgery
- Systemic or local disease or condition that could compromise post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
- Corticosteroids or any other medication that could influence post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Smoking more than 10 cigarettes/day
- Present alcohol and/or drug abuse
- Involvement in the planning and conduct of the study (applies to both Astra Tech staff and staff at the study site)
- Previous enrolment in the present study.
- Severe non-compliance to protocol as judged by the investigator and/or Astra Tech
- Simultaneous participation in another clinical study, or participation in a clinical study during the last 6 months

overall_official.affiliation: Direktor Clinical Research, Dentsply Sirona Implants, Mölndal, SWEDEN

facility.name: The University of Iowa, College of Dentistry
School of Dental Science, University of Melbourne
King's College London Dental Institute at Guy's King's and St Thomas' Hospitals

results_reference.citation: Guljé F, Abrahamsson I, Chen S, Stanford C, Zadeh H, Palmer R. Implants of 6 mm vs. 11 mm lengths in the posterior maxilla and mandible: a 1-year multicenter randomized controlled trial. Clin Oral Implants Res. 2013 Dec;24(12):1325-31. doi: 10.1111/clr.12001. Epub 2012 Sep 3.

Zadeh HH, Guljé F, Palmer PJ, Abrahamsson I, Chen S, Mahallati R, Stanford CM. Marginal bone level and survival of short and standard-length implants after 3 years: An Open Multi-Center Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial. Clin Oral Implants Res. 2018 Aug;29(8):894-906. doi: 10.1111/clr.13341. Epub 2018 Jul 12.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 97 subjects were enrolled in the study (singed informed consent).Two of those subjects fulfilled exclusion criteria and were removed from the study population before randomization. As a consequence a total of 95 subjects were randomised (assigned to groups) and received study treatment.

group.title: Group-1, Implant Length 6 mm
group.description: Subjects treated with OsseoSpeed™ implant, length: 6 mm

group.title: Group-2, Implant Length 11 mm

outcome.title: Radiological Assessments of Marginal Bone Level Alteration
outcome.description: Marginal Bone Level determined from radiographs and expressed as the difference from a reference point on the implant to the most coronal bone-to-implant contact on the mesial and distal aspect of the implant. Marginal Bone Level expressed in millimeters at the 5 year follow-up visit compared to values obtained at delivery of temporary restoration i.e. loading (baseline). Positive value = bone gain, Negative value = bone loss.
outcome.time_frame: Evaluated from implant installation to 5 years follow-up after implant placement
outcome.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the study. For a total of 10 implants (in 5 subjects) the quality of the radiographs were not sufficient for reading, giving a total of 80 subjects (174 implants) for the analysis of MBL change.

measure.title: Radiological Assessments of Marginal Bone Level Alteration
measure.description: Marginal Bone Level determined from radiographs and expressed as the difference from a reference point on the implant to the most coronal bone-to-implant contact on the mesial and distal aspect of the implant. Marginal Bone Level expressed in millimeters at the 5 year follow-up visit compared to values obtained at delivery of temporary restoration i.e. loading (baseline). Positive value = bone gain, Negative value = bone loss.
measure.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the study. For a total of 10 implants (in 5 subjects) the quality of the radiographs were not sufficient for reading, giving a total of 80 subjects (174 implants) for the analysis of MBL change.

outcome.title: Overall Implant Survival
outcome.description: Overall implant survival, measured on implant level
outcome.population: Group-1. A total of 49 subjects (108 positions) underwent surgery. Three positions were not implanted due to complications during surgery. Giving a total 105 implants installed. Group-2. A total of 46 subjects (101 positions) underwent surgery. Giving a total of 101 implants installed.

group.description: Subjects treated with OsseoSpeed™ implant, length: 6 mm

measure.title: Overall Implant Survival
measure.description: Overall implant survival, measured on implant level
measure.population: Group-1. A total of 49 subjects (108 positions) underwent surgery. Three positions were not implanted due to complications during surgery. Giving a total 105 implants installed. Group-2. A total of 46 subjects (101 positions) underwent surgery. Giving a total of 101 implants installed.

outcome.title: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment BoP
outcome.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of Bleeding on Probing (BoP). Presented as s count of implants that show presence of BoP.
outcome.time_frame: Measured at the 5-year follow-up visit after loading
outcome.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the 5-year follow-up visit. All included in the assessment of BoP.

group.title: Group-1, Implant Length 6 mm

measure.title: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment BoP
measure.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of Bleeding on Probing (BoP). Presented as s count of implants that show presence of BoP.
measure.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the 5-year follow-up visit. All included in the assessment of BoP.

outcome.title: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment of Change in PPD
outcome.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of change in probing pocket depth (PPD). Change in pocket depth expressed in millimeters at the 5-year follow-up visit, compared to values obtained at delivery of permanent restoration, i.e. loading (baseline). Negative value = increased pocket depth.
outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at implant loading and at the 5-year follow-up visit.
outcome.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the 5-year follow-up visit. Group-1. For 3 subjects (7 implants) the radiographs were not possible to evaluate, giving a total of 43 subjects (91 implants) being available for evaluation of change in PPD. Group-2. All radiographs readable, giving 39 subjects (86 positions) for the evaluation.

measure.title: Evaluation of the Periimplant Mucosa Condition - By Assessment of Change in PPD
measure.description: Condition of the periimplant mucosa by assessment of change in probing pocket depth (PPD). Change in pocket depth expressed in millimeters at the 5-year follow-up visit, compared to values obtained at delivery of permanent restoration, i.e. loading (baseline). Negative value = increased pocket depth.
measure.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the 5-year follow-up visit. Group-1. For 3 subjects (7 implants) the radiographs were not possible to evaluate, giving a total of 43 subjects (91 implants) being available for evaluation of change in PPD. Group-2. All radiographs readable, giving 39 subjects (86 positions) for the evaluation.

outcome.title: Presence of Plaque
outcome.description: Presence of plaque was evaluated at four surfaces around each study position (mesial, facial, distal and lingual). Plaque was recorded as presence or absence of plaque by visual inspection. A study position was considered as bleeding "yes" if at least one of the four surfaces around the implant showed presence of bleeding on probing.
outcome.time_frame: Evaluated at the 5-year follow-up visit after loading.
outcome.population: A total of 85 subjects (184 implants) completed the 5-year follow-up visit. All included in the assessment of presence of plaque.

event.sub_title: Armpit abscess due to spider bite.
Hip fracture due to car accident

event.description: Study implant failure (including implant mobility, excessive bone loss around implant and, implant related pain)
Loosening of the screw attaching the restoration (the bridge) to the implant abutment.
Fracture of the abutment connecting the implant with the restoration

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
